timeline.bodyText: Does a query allows having both named and positional parameters?
timeline.author: amaliujia

replies.bodyText: No. I updated the javadoc to clarify this.
replies.author: ibzib

timeline.bodyText:
My preference would be to have slightly more typed positionalParameters and namedParameters. If you like, you can do it robustly with @AutoOneOf, which would subsume also queryParameterMode.
https://github.com/google/auto/blob/master/value/userguide/howto.md#-make-a-class-where-only-one-of-its-properties-is-ever-set
timeline.author: kennknowles

replies.bodyText: Will do, thanks for the tip.
replies.author: ibzib

replies.bodyText: Looks like we will have to update to AutoValue 1.7 to be able to do none (void is not allowed in version 1.6.3 that we are using)
replies.author: ibzib

timeline.bodyText: This is a bit strange to me. Isn't the point of a builder that you only specify some of the args? I recognize that the oddness was pre-existing in this code.
timeline.author: kennknowles

replies.bodyText: It looks like it was set up this way because some of the public methods (e.g. registerUdaf) themselves include some boilerplate building, which is hidden from the user.
replies.author: ibzib

timeline.bodyText: Stylistically, SqlTransform would do better to have public builder methods. Is there a technical barrier? In other words, an API like SqlTransform.query(...).withParameters(...) or even .withNamedParameters separate from withPositionalParameters.
